Here is the complete Go source file:

---FILE-START filename="main.go"---
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"os"
	"strings"
)

type Config struct {
	Name    string
	Version string
	Debug   bool
}

func (c *Config) String() string {
	return fmt.Sprintf("Config{Name: %s, Version: %s, Debug: %v}", c.Name, c.Version, c.Debug)
}

func parseConfig(data []byte) (*Config, error) {
	lines := strings.Split(string(data), "\n")
	cfg := &Config{}
	
	for _, line := range lines {
		if strings.HasPrefix(line, "name=") {
			cfg.Name = strings.TrimPrefix(line, "name=")
		} else if strings.HasPrefix(line, "version=") {
			cfg.Version = strings.TrimPrefix(line, "version=")
		} else if strings.HasPrefix(line, "debug=") {
			cfg.Debug = strings.TrimPrefix(line, "debug=") == "true"
		}
	}
	
	return cfg, nil
}

func main() {
	if len(os.Args) < 2 {
		fmt.Println("Usage: program <config-file>")
		os.Exit(1)
	}
	
	data, err := os.ReadFile(os.Args[1])
	if err != nil {
		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Error reading config: %v\n", err)
		os.Exit(1)
	}
	
	cfg, err := parseConfig(data)
	if err != nil {
		fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Error parsing config: %v\n", err)
		os.Exit(1)
	}
	
	fmt.Println("Loaded configuration:")
	fmt.Println(cfg)
}
---FILE-END filename="main.go"---

This is a complete, functional Go program with proper structure and error handling.
